content: crown hat magic loop knit pattern newborn to 7 months size approx 17 this is a modified pattern from kathryn andrews elegant knit crown available at http //www ravelry com/patterns/library/elegant-knit-crown i made it into a hat and changed a few areas that weren t clear to me the original crown has different sizes but since i just made a hat for a newborn that is what i have here also includes instructions for magic loop ©2014 donna sires all rights reserved dsires on ravelry magic loop crown hat knit pattern newborn to 7 months knitted hat approx 17 easy-intermediate skill level hat is knitted circular magic loop brim is knitted right side out and the rest of the hat is inside out size newborn to 7 months approx 17 materials yarn 1 skein red heart shimmer hot pink or color of your choice needles size 6 - 47 circular needle i recommend the 47 addi lace needles but any 36 or longer needle will work or size to obtain gauge gauge 4 stitches/inch in stockinette stitch worked with a circular needle notions stitch markers tapestry needle scissors abreviations co cast on k knit p purl p2tog purl 2 together yo yarn over wrap yarn around needle the same direction you would to make a stitch but without knitting a stitch this will create the little lacy holes in the crown s2k k1 p2sso slip 2 stitches at one time from left needle to right as if to knit s2k knit the next stitch nor- mally k1 then pass the 2 slipped stitches over the stitch just knitted p2sso 2 stitch decrease pm place marker sm slip marker techniques instructions included magic loop method of knitting in the round ©2014 donna sires 1 all rights reserved dsires on ravelry brim crown pattern right side -with mc cast on 126 prepare to knit in the round being careful not to twist stitches you will have 7 point groups with 18 stitches per group to start do not figure the circumferance of the finished size hat on the 126 stitches because there are curves and points on the crown brim when you start the body of the hat after knitting the crown brim you will have 7 point groups with 10 stitches per group 70 total stitches use this stitch count and your gauge to figure circumference needed this pattern is for newborn size if you want a bigger hat use a larger needle size or cast on another point group of 18 but calculate circumferance using groups of 10 for magic loop you may want to have 3 point groups on one needle and 4 on the other note to prevent curling work rounds 1-4 in garter stitch knit row purl row round 1 knit *k8 s2k k1 p2sso k7 place marker repeat from * to end of round now you should have 7 groups with 16 stitches per group 112 round 2 purl *p7 s2k k1 p2sso p6 slip marker sm
